fr.sorbonne_u.components

Interface PluginI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractClientSidePlugin, AbstractPlugin, DataInterfacePushControlClientSidePlugin, DataInterfacesPushControlServerSidePlugin, DynamicConnectionClientSidePlugin, DynamicConnectionServerSidePlugin, ServerSideExample.ServerSidePlugin

    public interface PluginI
extends java.io.Serializable
    The interface PluginI defines the basic implementation services of component plug-ins seen as objects.

    Description

    This interface is implemented directly or indirectly by all objects implementing a plug-in. The default

    Created on : 2016-02-05

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void finalise()
      finalise the plug-in at least when the owner component is finalised.
      java.lang.String getPluginURI()
      return the URI of this plug-in.
      void initialise()
      initialise the plug-in by adding to the owner component every specific information, ports, etc. required to run the plug-in; subclasses should add any other initialisation necessary to make the plug-in work in the context of its owner.
      void installOn(ComponentI owner)
      initialise the plug-in reference to its owner component and add to the component every specific information, ports, etc. required to run the plug-in.
      boolean isInitialised()
      return true if the plug-in is fully initialised and ready to execute in the context of its owner component.
      void setPluginURI(java.lang.String uri)
      set the plug-in URI; this can be done only once to define the URI, attempts to redo it will raise an exception.
      void uninstall()
      uninstall the plug-in from its owner component.

 post   true                    // no postcondition.

      • setPluginURI

        void setPluginURI(java.lang.String uri)
           throws java.lang.Exception
        set the plug-in URI; this can be done only once to define the URI, attempts to redo it will raise an exception.

        Contract

         pre    uri != null
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        uri - the URI that will become the one of the plug-in.

      • installOn

        void installOn(ComponentI owner)
        throws java.lang.Exception
        initialise the plug-in reference to its owner component and add to the component every specific information, ports, etc. required to run the plug-in.

        Contract

         pre    owner != null
 pre    this.getPluginURI() != null
 pre    !owner.isInstalled(this.getPluginURI())
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        owner - component to which the plug-in is linked.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - todo.
